title: Representations - Logistic Models with Diff Eq

content.question: Information is spreading through a population. The number of people who have the information at time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> hours is modeled by an increasing function <math alttext="y of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> that satisfies a logistic differential equation. If the information is spreading most rapidly when <math alttext="7,500" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn><mtext>,500</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> people have the information, which of the following differential equations could represent this model?

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to t, equals, k times, open parenthesis, 7,500 minus y, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>500</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to t, equals, k times, open parenthesis, 15,000 minus y, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>15</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to t, equals, k y times, open parenthesis, 7,500 minus y, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>500</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to t, equals, k y times, open parenthesis, 15,000 minus y, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>15</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to t, equals, k y times, open parenthesis, 15,000 minus y, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>15</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 7.9: (BC ONLY) Logistic Models with Differential Equations

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
